column5: Ok, it's been a week and a half and have no map yet. I'm kinda beginning to wonder. I ended up calling him Thurs night and he said he had mailed it that day. So I expect yesterday being a holiday here maybe get it today or tomorrow?

Ordered my map on May 19, 2011, was stamped at the post office on May 24, 2011 and received in the mail today May 31, 2011.Unfortunately I believe there is going to be a postal strike on June 2, so hopefully your map will have reached the border before then.Cheers!
Still no map yet, maybe tomorrow. I would say it's probably is in the U.S. by now if he mailed it Thurs.
I received my map today, not as detailed as I expected, but still better than what I had. It does show depths and it is laminated. All the tips it gives is common knowledge stuff.
Has anyone ever ordered a map from this place? If so, how are they?

I have not ordered from them, but I have ordered from Canada Map Sales . com and Track Maps. com recently. I liked the maps I got from Track Maps better, but they were more expensive . . . each one the shipping was high, coming from Canada. Bill

I actually just ordered a map from there yesterday. The maps seem alright, but the lake map I wanted was nowhere else to be found so it was my only option. I think they seem a bit pricey for what you get. I have also ordered maps from Trak Maps and Canada Map Sales. I agree that the Trak Maps are one of the best available for printed maps. I wasn't overly impressed with the Canada Map Sales map, but again, sometimes it's good enough and better than nothing.Anyway, I can let you know when I receive it.What lake are you looking for?

We are going to Lount lake, it's on the English river system, Separation lake flows into it. I sent a money order Monday, so hopefully I will receive it next week sometime. I called and talked to him, he basicly read the map to me and answered all my questions. We are going the first week of September.

For anyone interested in bathymetric maps for lakes in the Abitibi-TÃ©miscamingue region of north west Quebec, many of them are available on-line free of charge at http://www.mrn.gouv.qc.ca/abitibi-te...ymetriques.jsp
Let me know how long it takes you to receive your map, did you order it online or mail off for it?

As good as any map for Lac Seul, not inexpensive and since they are from Canada they can get held up in customs. If you are needing a map quickly, I would not count on Trak Maps to be delivered in your time window (quickly to me is less than 2 weeks).Maybe things have changed since I ordered a year ago on-line.

I emailed him my information and phoned in my CC number. I actually need to follow up since I haven't heard back from him.I also live in Canada, so the time it takes for me to receive it may not be comparable to someone in the US. I will let you know though.
http://www.anglersatlas.com/Try this one it is free and has many NWO lakes with depths.
The map you posted is not the right Lount Lake, I guess there is 2!
